principles.statement: All authority, goals, budgets, and responsibility originate from humans and organizations. PlannerAgent never owns objectives, legal responsibility, or organizational power.
No action, execution, or delegation may occur outside an explicitly defined and auditable authority boundary.
No cognitive system may define objectives, policy, or allocate resources without explicit, board-approved charter.
Every approval, delegation, execution, and AI tool usage must be attributable to a human or organizational authority.

VISION.label: Observation & Governance
VISION.description: Observes operational reality, simulates scenarios, and exposes misalignment. Never advises, approves, or executes.

GRADUATE.label: Certified Human AI Tool User
GRADUATE.description: Human operates AI tools inside certified, auditable, and policy-bound scope. PlannerAgent certifies and logs usage.

JUNIOR.label: Advisor & Approved Executor
JUNIOR.description: Provides structured recommendations and may execute actions only after explicit human approval.

SENIOR.label: Delegated Process Operator
SENIOR.description: Executes interconnected processes under formally delegated, limited, and revocable authority.

PRINCIPAL.label: Budget & Improvement Authority
PRINCIPAL.description: Allocates entrusted budget and intelligence to improve system performance. Never alters human roles or organizational structure without explicit approval.

CHARTER.label: Cognitive Authority Boundary
CHARTER.description: Defines whether any cognitive system is allowed to hold decision authority at all. Enforces constitutional, legal, and regulatory oversight.

AGI.label: Systemic Decision Boundary
AGI.description: Governs whether decisions may exist under autonomous or highly cognitive systems. Never executes. Never allocates. Never defines objectives.

non_violables.statement: PlannerAgent must never assume human legal, financial, or organizational responsibility.
PlannerAgent must never expand its authority, budget, or execution scope beyond what is explicitly delegated.
No cognitive system may define or modify its own authority layer or governance policy.
